title: Catalogue retailer N Brown cheers investors with turnaround plan despite tumbling profits
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Oct 14, 2015, 10:55 BST - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 35 mins Catalogue retailer N Brown cheers investors with turnaround plan despite tumbling profits By Ashley Armstrong | Telegraph – 15 minutes ago 337.60 +21.600 
Retailer behind the Jacamo and Simply Be brands says that sales have risen while pre-tax profits plunged on restructuring costs 
Shares (Berlin: DI6.BE - news ) in N Brown (LSE: BWNG.L - news ) have risen after the retailer posted a rise in half-year sales and said that it was confident of its full-year outlook. 
The upbeat tone was a relief for investors after the catalogue retailer issued its second profit warning in less than six months in March as a result of heavy discounting to shift its winter clothes. 
N Brown was up 20.6p, or 6.5pc, to 336.5p in morning trading on the back of the first-half results. 
However the company, which runs the Simply Be and Jacamo clothing brands, revealed a 54.6pc slump in pre-tax profits to £19.4m as a result of the cost of shutting 18 clearance stores. 
The store closures follow a new strategy by chief executive Angela Spindler who is transforming N Brown from a catalogue retailer to an online retailer. 
Around 63pc of the company's sales are now online compared to 58pc last year. 
"We have continued to execute significant changes in H1 and have delivered results in line with our expectations," Ms Spindler said. 
"We are adjusting our retail business model and the way we operate, transforming from direct mail-led to digital first. This has been driven by a clear understanding of what customers want, and fuelled by technology." 
N Brown's underlying pre-tax profits, which exclude the restructuring costs and foreign exchange movements, were still 15.9pc lower year-on-year at £35m. 
The group said that its turnaround of 50s-plus fashion brand JD Williams would take the longest of all its brands after reporting flat half-year sales at £103m. The group's plus-sized womenswear brand, Simply Be, recorded a 21.4pc lift in sales to £50.2m while its Jacamo menswear brand also reported a 21.4pc lift in sales over the same period to £30.4m. 
N Brown has boosted its social media campaigns to drive online awareness, such as by searching for real customers to be the face of this year's Simply Be Christmas campaign via Twitter (Xetra: A1W6XZ - news ) and launching a viral video of former England captain Matt Dawson doing the "Hakarena" for the Jacamo brand. 
The company said that its market niches - it clothes are mainly focused on the plus size and over 50-years-old market - would have significant growth opportunities. 
In a show of confidence the company said that it was keeping its interim dividend at 5.67p.
